qas.question: What Bermuda sport team participated in the 2007 world cup?
Who is Bermuda's most popular Cricket player?
What began in 1872 when the game of cricket was introduced to Bermuda?
Why is there an East End/West End rivalry?
What team participated in the 2007 World Cup Cricket?
Who is 130 lb Dwayne Leverock to the cricket team?
What job title does Dwayne Hemp hold?

plausible_answers.text: a former captain of Glamorgan in English first class cricket.

context: <b5_0>Bermuda's <a0_0>national cricket team<b5_0/><a0_0/> participated in the Cricket World Cup 2007 in the West Indies. <b6_0>Their most famous player<b6_0/> is a 130 kilograms (290 lb) <b7_0>police officer<b7_0/> named <a1_0>Dwayne Leverock<a1_0/>. But <a2_0>India<a2_0/> defeated Bermuda and set a record of 413 runs in a One-Day International (ODI). Bermuda were knocked out of the World Cup. Also very well-known is David Hemp, <b8_0>a former captain of Glamorgan in English first class cricket.<b8_0/> <b9_0>The <a3_0>annual "Cup Match"<a3_0/> cricket tournament<b9_0/> between rival parishes St George's in the east and Somerset in the west is the occasion for a popular national holiday. This tournament began in 1872 when Captain Moresby of the Royal Navy introduced the game to Bermuda, holding a match at Somerset to mark forty years since the unjust thraldom of slavery. The East End versus West End <a4_0>rivalry resulted from the locations<a4_0/> of the St. George's Garrison (the original army headquarters in Bermuda) on Barrack Hill, St. George's, and the Royal Naval Dockyard at Ireland Island. Moresby founded the Somerset Cricket Club which plays the St. George's Cricket Club in this game (the membership of both clubs has long been mostly civilian).
